intro: Primula officinalis subf. maxima, commonly known as the greater primrose, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, often with a distinctive red or purple throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and slightly serrated. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. The flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological importance in its native range.
